page.title: 02POTTERS GREEN FUNDAY 1985
page.content: Every year at{Potters Green}there is a {Carnival}and{Funday.}The Funday takes place at Potters Green School.At the 1985 Funday there was an inflatable{ {Wally the Whale},a{mini fair}which had rides for little children to go on and{mini motor bikes}to ride on. There was an{arcade}with lots of electronic games.There were also a lot of{stalls}selling such things as toys,garden tools, computer games and sweets.All these things and more were sold cheaply.The{Carnival}took place on Sunday 16th June,and had 7 floats.The judges included the{Deputy {Lord Mayor}Cllr Mrs.W.Lakin,and the managing director of Coventry's new {cable television}service John Ross-Bernard.The Funday raised over Â£700 for{Potters Green Home-School {Association}funds and more than{3000 people came.
